title: Max Schrems on the EU court ruling that could cut Facebook in two
text: Last month’s ruling by the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU), ripping up the EU-US Privacy Shield and sewing doubt over alternative mechanisms, has put a cat among the pigeons of international data transfers. For Facebook the impact could fall like a cleaving sword as its business is front and center following the […]

title: Facebook, Starbucks Lift Nasdaq to 4th Straight Record High
text: The social media giant even survived a snub from the Dow.

title: Facebook, Twitter execs are bracing for protecting integrity during upcoming elections
text: Security executives from Facebook Inc. FB, +3.83% and Twitter Inc. TWTR, -0.23% are gearing up for a long run-up to election night, and the days following it.

title: Facebook Stock Hits High As Social Media Giant Unveils E-Commerce Features
text: Facebook announced several e-commerce features on Tuesday, including a series of tools designed to expand shopping on its social media platforms. Facebook stock climbed to a new high.

title: Facebook changes name of its annual VR event and its overall AR/VR organization
text: Facebook is moving further away from the Oculus brand. The company says it is changing the name of their augmented reality and virtual reality division to “Facebook Reality Labs,” a division which will encompass the company’s AR/VR products under the Oculus, Spark and Portal brands.

title: Facebook stock climbs after it expands shopping in main app, Instagram
text: Facebook stock climbed 2.5 percent Tuesday afternoon after the social network announced expanded shopping capabilities on its main app as well as on Instagram.

title: Fmr. Amazon Prime vp on Facebook's new "shop" feature that allows small businesses to sell direct to
text: Amazon Prime inventor and Tapas Capital advisor Greg Greeley joins 'Squawk Alley' to talk about Apple's App Store regulations and Facebook's new e-commerce feature that will allow more business owners to sell their products directly to consumers through the social media app.

title: Facebook and Instagram will expand e-commerce tools for consumers
text: Facebook just announced a new dedicated "shop" tab which will allow small business owners to sell their products directly to consumers and let consumers easily purchase items through the social media app.

title: Facebook is bringing a Shop section to its app, while Instagram expands Live Shopping
text: Facebook is announcing a number of new e-commerce features both within the main Facebook app and on Instagram. The pandemic has forced many businesses to shift online, and Facebook made a big announcement in May around the ability of merchants to create Facebook Shops that are viewable on both Facebook and Instagram.

title: Facebook plans news service launch in UK, India, Brazil
text: Facebook Inc said on Tuesday it plans to launch its news service in the United Kingdom, Germany, France, India and Brazil in the coming months, after having introduced the feature in the United States last year.

title: Facebook News to expand internationally to the U.K., Germany, France, India, and Brazil
text: Facebook News, the social network’s dedicated news section launched to U.S. audiences in June, is soon expanding to international markets.

title: Facebook Will Challenge Thai Government Order To Block A Popular Group Criticising Its King
text: Access to the group which has more than 1 million members was blocked in Thailand after an order was issued by the government.

title: Facebook Plans Legal Action After Thailand Tells It to Mute Critics
text: After a warning from the government, the company restricted access to a Facebook group critical of the Thai monarchy. But it said it would challenge the order.

title: Facebook blocks access to group criticising Thailand's monarchy
text: Curb on 1m-member ‘Royalist Marketplace’ comes after legal threat from Thai government

title: After restricting a group critical of Thailand’s monarchy, Facebook says it will take legal action against the government
text: After restricting access to a popular group with posts critical of Thailand’s monarchy, Facebook is planning legal action against the Thai government, which the social media giant says forced it to restrict content deemed to be illegal. On Monday, Reuters reported access to Royalist Marketplace had been blocked within Thailand.

title: Facebook says plans to challenge Thai government demand to block group critical of monarchy
text: Facebook said on Tuesday it was planning to legally challenge the Thai government after being "compelled" to block access within Thailand to a group with 1 million members that discusses the country's king.
